info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND WEST CENTRAL ALLEGHENY COUNTIES... At 649 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over McDonald, or 8 miles northwest of Canonsburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... McMurray, Canonsburg, Avella, Upper St. Clair, Robinson Township, Cecil-Bishop, Kennedy Township, Bridgeville, McGovern, Imperial, McDonald, Sturgeon-Noblestown, Oakdale, Burgettstown, Houston, Hickory, Slovan, Collier Township, Enlow, and South Fayette Township. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
